intro: Ochthocosmus glaber, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a pink to reddish hue. Ochthocosmus glaber produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
